page.title: 07 "The Home 1985"
page.content: During our survey, a total of thirty houses were involved.We found that everybody was only too pleased to participate once they knew what the project incurred. Relating to the questionaire, question 1, number 1, we found that the majority were owners of their homes with only a small minority being tenants. The average number of occupants was 4-5, made up of families rather than couples.Six of the houses involved had grand-parents living with their families.It is also interesting to know that all six houses were farms and that these farms had been passed down from generation to generation. The age of the houses varied quite considerably.The oldest was a farmhouse and barn dating back some 400 years.
